results.title: Manyu-Wana 2 (A)
results.creator_credit: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Working for the Yuendumu Mining Co.; reading of “The Story of the Perentie”; words for ‘far’ and ‘close’; cleaning teeth, washing eyes; fire-making; story about a little kangaroo looking for its mother; shirt magic; number 2. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.

results.title: Manyu-Wana 1 (A)
results.creator_credit: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This program contains the following topics: Magic; number 3; working as a stockman; reading of “The Man and the tree”; number 1; blowing noses; letter “M”; making hairstring; words for ‘wide’ and ‘narrow’; car magic; bat and ball magic. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.

results.title: Managing the Micro
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Getting in on the Act
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Managing the Micro”.
Looks at how microelectronics can be introduced into a produce or process, what skills are needed, and what risks are involved. Also how management can get enough of an idea to be able to talk sensibly about the technology. Illustrative material includes film of a successful engineering company and a micro-controlled greenhouse. A studio demonstration explores what would be involved in designing, developing and making a proposed new product - a micro-controlled piano tuner
results.description:

Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry → Industrial management

results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

group_siblings.title: Thinking Small
group_siblings.creator_credit: David Allen

results.title: Thinking Small
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Managing the Micro”.
A chance to explore the opportunities which microelectronics offers large, medium and small companies, explaining how the technology differs from earlier technology and what its characteristics are. Case studies include a garment maker, a paper mill, a woodyard and a major manufacturer of tailor-made equipment using computer-aided design and manufacture

results.title: Managing disobedient behaviour
results.creator_credit: Tim Abbott, Helen Edwards, Tony Shaddock and New England Educational Diagnostic Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Managing difficult behaviours”.
Module 3.2. Designed to assist the intellectual disability residential care worker to understand what disobedient behaviour is, why it occurs, how to prevent such behaviour, how to deal with disobedience which has become a regular behaviour pattern and how to manage disobedient behaviour crises. Accompanied by 45p. in-service training manual.

results.title: Managing aggressive behaviour
results.creator_credit: Tim Abbott, Helen Edwards, Tony Shaddock and New England Educational Diagnostic Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Managing difficult behaviours”.
Module 3.1. Designed to assist the intellectual disability residential care worker to understand why aggressive behaviour occurs, learn how to “get in first” to avoid aggressive outbursts and how to deal systematically with particular forms of aggressive behaviour that have become a regular behaviour pattern. Accompanied by 48p. in-service training manual.

results.title: The Goya effect
results.creator_credit: Michael Tuchner, Ian Latimer and Rank Aldis Industrial Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Manager in Action”.
Demonstrates the limitations of formal information systems. Highlights the importance of spending time at the “sharp” end and the role of non-verbal signals in face to face communication. Intended for middle and junior managers in industrial and commercial organisations.
